fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence page title overlay the header when clicking Application Navigator
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open confluence page with long article or make browser smaller
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-02 at 15.05.08.png|thumbnail!
 # Click Application Navigator
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-02 at 15.05.13.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Confluence page title can see properly
h3. Actual Results

Title overlay the header
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence page title overlay the header when clicking Application Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user that does not have the Attachments "Add" permission on the space, and they drag and drop a file to Confluence, a generic error is sometimes thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 7.4.0
# Setup permissions as shown here: [^spaceperms.png]
# With a user that only belongs to *confluence-users* go to a page on that space
# When viewing the page (not in the editor), drag and drop an attachment to Confluence of small size (less than 1mb)
# Then upload a larger attachment (50mb+)

h3. Expected Results

The following error should be returned right away:
{noformat}
You'll need to ask for permission to insert files here.
{noformat}

This error is usually thrown when uploading small files. 

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the browser: 
!wrongerror.png|thumbnail!

The dialog window will also show an upload "in progress", and show a progress bar, even if the user does not have permissions to upload to any page on the space. Eventually it throws the "server cannot be reached" error

h3. Notes
This behavior is intermittent. Sometimes it works and throws the appropriate permission error, and sometimes it cannot be replicated. The following has been tried to workaround this issue: 
* Tested in multiple browsers
* Reset *server.xml* to make sure the default is being used
* Removed *protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Nio2Protocol"* from server.xml
* Flushed browser and Confluence cache
* Multiple file formats (zip, png, jpg, mp4, etc.)

*_Regardless of the error, the file will not be uploaded if you do not have permission_*. So this should not pose any security risks. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Uploading file to Confluence page without space attachment permission can throw incorrect error

fields.description:
h2. Problem

Inserting anchor links is error prone and slow, [see the current documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF56/Working+with+Anchors]. Very similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-67372 for Confluence Cloud, this is a request for similar enhancement on Confluence Server / Datacenter.

!image-2020-10-01-13-20-43-641.png|width=550,height=299!
h2. Suggestion/Feature Request:

Streamline and speed up inserting links to anchors with having a search methodology for anchors (similar to how pages are searched). This could prevent errors with spaces in the anchor name, typos, and getting the wrong anchor. Also, if it were in a new area specifically for anchor links, and not hidden on the Advanced tab it would be quicker for new users to apply.
fields.summary: Search for anchors to insert anchor links instead of typing them verbatim in Advanced area

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a space backup is restored on Confluence instance, none of the Confluence pages where Jira issues are included get references on the Jira side under I*ssue Links >> Mentioned in*
h3. Steps to Reproduce

For this test, you need two instances of Confluence and one Jira instance
 # Create application link between Confluence-A instance and Jira
 # Create application link between Confluence-B instance and Jira
 # Create *page-A* inside *space-A* on *Confluence-A*
 # Insert any Jira Issue from Jira projects inside *Page-A* >> publish
 (notice that *1 Jira link* icon appears next to the page title)
 # Go to Jira and check the Jira issue, you see that the Confluence page is referenced under *issue links* >> *mentioned in*
 # **Now export *space-A* from *Confluence-A* instance as XML
 # Restore the space XML file on *Confluence-B*
 # Go to *Page-A* on *Confluence-B,* notice +there is no icon+ next to page title showing (1 Jira link) and *page-A* from *Confluence-B* isn't listed under *mentioned in* section of the Jira issue on the Jira side

h3. Expected Results

Upon restoring a space backup, Confluence pages with Jira issues should be listed under *"Issue links >> Mentioned In"* in Jira accordingly
h3. Actual Results

Upon restoring a space backup, Confluence pages with Jira issues are not listed under *"Issue links >> Mentioned In"* in Jira
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence pages aren't referenced under "Mentioned in" in Jira after space restore

fields.description:
If you import/restore an XML backup, we will have the information below:

* *Importing Data - In Progress*

If the restore is complete, the message will not be changed, and we will only have a tiny "complete" message under the progress bar.

It would be good to have a clearer and bigger message since the *Importing Data - In Progress* may tell that the restore is still going on.
fields.summary: Improve the importing message when the restore is complete

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Certain Google doc pdfs are not rendering in the PDF macro preview

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a google doc
 # export the google doc to a pdf
 # attach  the pdf to a Confluence page
 # Insert a PDF macro with the page

h3. Expected Results
The pdf macro preview should render text and content

h3. Actual Results

It shows a blank PDF preview 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. Certain google docs such as the sample.pdf do seem to render previews properly.
fields.summary: Certain Google doc pdfs are not rendering in the PDF macro preview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing the Cell Color on page tables is not honored in PDF export 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a wiki page, insert a table and fill in with cell colors OR select an existing page containing tables with filled-in cell colors
Update the page and publish
Go to page options ( ...) and select Export as PDF
Verify the pdf file.

h3. Expected Results
The table should be exported with the filled-in cell colors along with the content.

h3. Actual Results

Content is exported without any error. The newly added cell colors are not. Existing cell colors ( existing since the previous version) are exported and displayed in the pdf file.

h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Changing the Cell Color on page tables is not honored in PDF export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user is modified(disabled, removed from AD, renamed), the Recently Updated macro will show that an Anonymous user made changes to the profile/page of the modified user.

Note: The improvement https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33941 states that the problem happens when Confluence is connected to Jira, but you can also reproduce the issue using the Internal Directory or any external directory

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the "Recently Updated" macro to one page.
# Login with a different user and create a new Personal Space and also update the profile of the user.
# Login with the admin.
# Delete the user from step 2.

h3. Expected Results

The macro will show the "Unknown User(username)" of the user in the content that was updated by the modified user. 

h3. Actual Results

The macro shows that an anonymous user updated the content

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Modified users display as anonymous in the recently updated macro

fields.description:
It would be good if there was the possibility to have an editing history for comments. When it was changed by whom and you can still see the old text about it.
Unfortunately the permissions are such that space administrators can always edit comments. But the changes are not traceable, which can lead to misuse of the function.
fields.summary: Comment History

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Regarding [https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/oauth-error-oauth_problem-signature_invalid-720406720.html], suggested KB talks about to change the useBodyEncodingForURI to false but Confluence Docker image doesn't have any parameter to change this value other than the default.
h3. Expected Results

Confluence Docker Image should have a parameter for changing the useBodyEncodingForURI to false in server.xml file. server.xml.j2 (jinja template) should have that value as a parameter.
h3. Actual Results

Currently it shows true and that is the default value. We can't change this value to false.
h3. Workaround

Manually update the server.xml.j2 file with proper information and restart the Confluence container.
fields.summary: docker image confluence-server, useBodyEncodingForURI set as parameter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you generate a page property report macro from a page property macro with a column including task list element (the square brackets) without any text, the page property report does not show anything for this column.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Insert a page property macro with the desired label
 # Use task list element without any text for one of the page property column's value
 # Create another page
 # Insert a page property report macro and use the above label for filtering the above page property

h3. Expected Results

Column with the task list element is displayed in the page property report

!6_15_4-page_properties.png|width=256,height=146!!6_15_4-page_properties_report.png|width=256,height=146!
h3. Actual Results

Column with the task list element is not displayed, this column is empty.

  !7_7_3-page_properties.png|width=256,height=146!!7_7_3-page_properties_report.png|width=256,height=146!
h3. Workaround

1. If you put some text to the task list element, it will be displayed in the page property report.

2. Enable "masterdetail.legacy.parse" dark feature in Confluence. This will result in slower report generation and a hard limit of 1000 rows in the report. 


 

(i) This is working as expected in the older version of Confluence, tested in version 6.15.4.
fields.summary: Page Property Report Macro does not show the task list element without any text

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When Confluence is configured with a mail server, Confluence users are able to request for a Password Reset email from the login page by entering a valid username or email address after clicking on the "Forgot your password?" link.
 !login screenshot.png|thumbnail! 


However, there is no spam control to this action as the user can click the "Send it to me" button multiple times without any cooldown or verification which in a way can cause a burden to either Confluence or the mail server.
 !send link screenshot.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implementation of spam control such as CAPTCHA when a continuous attempt to request the password reset email is detected.
fields.summary: Spam Control for Password Reset email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an LDAP user is synchronized to Confluence without membership in a group that confers can-use access, that user will not be indexed. If LDAP is configured to auto-add users to a "can-use" group when they authenticate for the first time, then when the user logs in they will be able to access and use Confluence, but they won't be re-indexed with that group, and so will still not be found in any feature that uses the index, like mentions, the people directory, etc. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create LDAP directory (Connector type) in Confluence, making sure that none of the LDAP groups confer can-use access
# Configure the directory to auto-add users to "confluence-users" 
# Synchronize directory. User should appear on the "Users" screen without membership in any can-use group.
# Search for that user in People Directory or try to mention them on a page. This shouldn't be possible since the user does not belong to a group that can access Confluence. This is expected. 
# Wait for user to log in for first time and be added to "confluence-users" group
# Search for that user in People Directory or try to mention them on a page

h3. Expected Results

The user can be found in the People Directory and in any other feature that utilizes the index

h3. Actual Results

User cannot be found in the index, even though they appear on the "Users" screen and can log in with membership in a can-use group

h3. Workaround

Make a minor edit to the user's profile to trigger a re-index of their user object.
fields.summary: LDAP users that are auto-added to a can-use group are not re-indexed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

_Questions for Confluence_ doesn't handle certain special characters solely as the title.  _Questions for Confluence_ still accepts the question in the UI, but afterwards users can't easily access the question and therefore cannot delete it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install _Questions for Confluence_
 # Enter a new question of '????' (without the quotes)
 # The question will show up in the 'Recent' questions list but the link to it is not functional and the question cannot be easily removed unless the '?' characters are passed on the URL as %3F.  eg.  (http://localhost:8090/questions/5144594/%3F%3F%3F%3F%3F?src=browse)

h3. Expected Results

Any accepted input should be handled and encoded correctly in links encoded within _Questions for Confluence_.
h3. Actual Results

A created question using only special characters (eg. ???) is not accessible.

 
||Question||Encoding||Ok?||
|Is there anyone out there?|http://localhost:8090/questions/5144606/is-there-anyone-out-there?src=browse|Ok|
|_????_|http://localhost:8090/questions/5144594/?src=browse|Not ok|
|##|http://localhost:8090/questions/5144616/%23%23|Ok|
|%%%|http://localhost:8090/questions/5144627/?src=browse|Not ok|

 

 
h3. Workaround

Manually append the character encoding if it has been removed. For example, to access a question of '????', modify the URL from:
{code:java}
http://localhost:8090/questions/5144594/?src=browse {code}
to
{code:java}
 http://localhost:8090/questions/5144594/%3F%3F%3F%3F?src=browse{code}
UTF-8 encoding can be referenced from [W3schools|https://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.ASP]. 

Whilst not a suitable workaround for users, this will allow inaccessible questions to be accessed and deleted.
fields.summary: Creating questions in Questions for Confluence solely using certain characters leaves the question inaccessible

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Uploaded documents could not render properly due to missing CJK fonts.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an English language Linux system so that Chinese fonts are not part of the installation
 # Set up Confluence on it
 # Upload a Chinese powerpoint file on a page
 # Preview this file

h3. Expected Results

Chinese text should be readable
h3. Actual Results

Text is garbled or rendered as squares or blank.

  !image-2020-09-28-15-35-57-200.png|width=328,height=234!
h3. Workaround

Install the missing fonts manually as explained in this knowledge base article

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/the-text-in-a-powerpoint-excel-or-word-document-looks-different-when-using-the-viewfile-macro-200213562.html]
fields.summary: Confluence doesn't install Chinese, Japanese and Korean fonts on Linux

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Color picker for cell color and text color in edit mode malfunctions when adding frontend.editor.v4.disable to dark feature,
h3. Environment

LInux
 Postgres v9.6.14
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to <[http://localhost:8090|http://localhost:8090/]>/admin/darkfeatures.action.
 # Add *frontend.editor.v4.disable*.
 # Open page.
 # Open edit mode.
 # Click on color picker for text or table cell.

h3. Expected Results

Color picker displays as expected
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-22 at 11.44.35 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

!confluence 7-5-2 color picker - table.png|thumbnail! 
 !confluence 7-5-2 color picker - text.png|thumbnail! 
 Color picker renders distorted.
h3. Workaround

Remove *frontend.editor.v4.disable* from dark features.
 * Navigate to <[http://localhost:8090|http://localhost:8090/]>/admin/darkfeatures.action.
 * Click remove for feature.

h3.
fields.summary: Color picker in edit mode malfunctions when frontend.editor.v4.disable is introduced in the dark-feature.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We would like to have reminders set for each individual events rather than, just each *Event Types*, like we have in Microsoft Outlook Calendar. Maybe we can configure a global reminder for *event type*, and then separate reminder is also possible for each individual events created.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Event with Event Type as default "Events"
 # Navigate to the calendar and try to set reminder for the Event created (We don't have an option here and reminder can be set against the Event Types only)

h3. Expected Results

Once, an Event is created, we should be able to set reminder for each event individually.
h3. Actual Results

We can set the Reminder only for *Event Types* as a whole but not to each event created individually.
h3. Workaround

We can create multiple Custom Event Types, as a workaround, which will allow us to set reminder for each of them individually. But, yes that can be an extra work with lots of Custom Event types to manage. I have tried this and below is the screenshot for your quick reference:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: We would like to have reminders set for each individual events rather than, just each Event Types, like we have in Microsoft Outlook Calendar.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an event, changing the calendar while custom event selected, and creating the event without touching another thing, a default type event will be created instead of a custom one. And also, if the default types are hidden for this calendar, deleting the event is not possible without allowing the default type again.

Confluence version: 7.7.3
 Team Calendars version: 6.0.53
h3. Steps to Reproduce

[^screen_capture_2020_09_25.mp4]
 # Create two calendars (Calendar-1, Calendar-2)
 # In the calendar edit menu, navigate to "Event Types" and hide all default event types for both calendar
 # Again in the "Event Types" menu, create one custom event type for each calendar (C1-Custom-Event for Calendar-1, C2-Custom-Event for Calendar-2)
 # Click "Add Event"
 # Leave the selected calendar on which one comes default. (ex: Calendar-1)
 # Select the custom event created for this calendar. (ex: C1-Custom-Event)
 # When the event details section is displayed, change the calendar to the other one (ex: Calendar-1 -> Calendar-2)
 # Without changing anything else, enter the event name and save it.

h3. Expected Results

Event created with the selected custom event type.
h3. Actual Results

Event created with the default event type.

 

The below exception is thrown in the Atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
 2020-09-25 11:08:27,188 WARN [http-nio-6773-exec-10] [extra.calendar3.util.TimeZoneUtil] tryParseDateTimeStringForEventEdit Unable to parse date null
 -- referer: http://localhost:6773/c773/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /c773/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | traceId: d57bf9ae86c3a470 | userName: admin
2020-09-25 11:08:31,098 WARN [http-nio-6773-exec-5] [confluence.impl.hibernate.ConfluenceHibernateTransactionManager] doRollback Performing rollback. Transactions:
  ->[PluginReadWriteTx]: PROPAGATION_REQUIRED,ISOLATION_DEFAULT (Session #388162233)
 -- referer: http://localhost:6773/c773/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /c773/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | traceId: bab7e6f5ecbaae98 | userName: admin
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

When creating an event, after changing the calendar with a custom event selected, even the custom event type populated correctly to the combo box, you need to choose it again. That way, you can create the event with the desired type.
fields.summary: Creating custom event and changing calendar creates default type event in Team Calendars

fields.description:
It would be good to configurate where to be redirected after cancle a site-creation.

 

Currently you will be redirected to [https://myconfluence.com/dashboard.action#recently-worked.] I would like to configure, that I jump back to the site, where I started to create that site.
fields.summary: Configurable Redirect

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Confluence holds a lot of Spaces and Pages. Inside them, here is an old macro that they do not want to use any longer. Confluence does not allow a way to remove a macro for all pages at once. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a feature that you can select a Macro and Pages to remove them in bulk. Opting to leave the content on or not.

h3. Why This Is Important
This is a lot of manual work, as Space admins must go page by page and remove them manually.

h3. Workaround
Manual work.
fields.summary: Remove a custom macro in bulk and ensure the text stays on
Code Block Macro doesn't retain JSON formatting in Confluence 7.7.3 and above

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Confluence is running behind a reverse proxy (tested with nginx and apache), clicking on an older version of a file listed under attachments macro results in page not found.

This issue does not occur when you go to "..." >> attachments >> and click on old versions of the attachments.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run Confluence behind a reverse proxy
 # Create a new page
 # Add attachment with + sign in the filename (repeat to create few versions)
 # Insert "Attachments Macro"
 # Publish the page
 # Next to the attachment filename, expand versions and click on an old version of the file
 # Error Page not found

h3. Expected Results

The file should be downloaded when clicking on old version of a file (with + sign in the filename) in Attachments macro
h3. Actual Results

When clicking on old version of a file (with + sign in the filename) in Attachments macro, you get page not found
h3. Workaround

Found that the URL displays the following:
{{https://HOSTNAME/wiki/download/attachments/2654266/Example%20Sheet%20%2B.xlsx?version=1&modificationDate=1457999001396&api=v2}}

After URL manipulation, found that the {{&modificationDate=1457999001396&}} section appears to break the URL. 

If it is removed and replaced with a Single Ampersand '&', the previous version file can be downloaded successfully: 

{{https://HOSTNAME/wiki/download/attachments/2654266/Example%20Sheet%20%2B.xlsx?version=1&api=v2}}
fields.summary: Clicking on old versions of an attachment with + sign under "Attachments macro" results in page not found

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While German is set as profile/site language, in the search function, the label of the "_type" filter_ in German should be shown as *Typ* with capital T instead of *typ*. The case needs to be like other filter labels.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set German for the language of the Confluence site or profile.
 # Click search on the top right.
 # When the search menu opens, on the left side of the search menu, you can see filter combo boxes. The label for the _type filter_ has the case issue.

!case_problem.png|width=400,height=203!
h3. Expected Results

The label for the type is *Typ* while the German language is set.
h3. Actual Results

The label for the type is *typ* while the German language is set.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Case error in Confluence search filter label in German translation

fields.description:
If I am looking at a page I would like the option to do a search which searches only the current page / children. This would make the search feature 10x more useful on a day to day basis.

If I am looking at a space I would like the option to do a search which only searches the current space (without having to manually add the space name in the search screen after I've already done the search). This would prevent the extra (annoying) step of having to work out the space you were looking at and entering this manually on the search page.

This could easily be achieved in the UI by adding a couple of checkboxes next to the search box, for example: "Current Space", "Current Location" would be simple and contextual.
fields.summary: Search in current location / space

fields.description:
On confluence spaces, it is possible to reorder pages alphabetically but this happens to only be done ones. Meaning when a new page is created, the alphabetical order is no longer respected and the page gets created at the bottom of the pages tree.

The purpose of ordering alphabetically is to allow order and consistency in viewing the pages and creating new page should obey the alphabetical ordering once selected.

This is the same feature as requested under [CONFCLOUD-65454|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65454], but for Confluence Server and Data Center.
fields.summary: Reorder pages alphabetically (permanently)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, if a user specifies a page link inside the Include Page macro using the Space Key parameter and the page happens to have the colon (:) right after the first word in the title, the macro will remove the space key and consider part of the title as the space key value when you first edit the page where the macro is placed.

{{If the page title is ‘THIS: is a test title created’}}

*This:*

{{MAL:THIS: is a test title created}}

*Becomes this:*

{{THIS: is a test title created}}

Adding the space key parameter again seems to fix the issue and editing the page can be done normally.

Documentation on the macro

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/include-page-macro-139514.html]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page that contains a colon right after the first word in the title
 # Publish the page
 # Create a new page on the same space as the previous one
 # Add the Include Page macro
 # Specify the previously created page using space key value (eg. SPC:THIS: title)
 # Publish the page
 # Edit the page

h3. Expected Results

The space key value is still there and the page is found
h3. Actual Results

The space key value is removed and the page is not found.

*Before publishing the page*

!Screen Shot 2020-09-23 at 15.27.42.png|width=418,height=113!

*After publishing the page*

*!Screen Shot 2020-09-23 at 15.27.50.png|width=379,height=81!*

*First page edit*

notice the missing space key

*!Screen Shot 2020-09-23 at 15.28.00.png|width=415,height=126!*

*First edit, view mode*

*!Screen Shot 2020-09-23 at 15.28.08.png|width=365,height=90!*
h3. Workaround

Edit the page and add the space key back. After the first edit, the space key value sticks to the original value.
fields.summary: Specifying a space key for a page that has a colon (:) right after the first word in the title and it exists on the same space where the Include Page macro is included removes the space key after first edit

fields.description:

 # Navigate to "..." > Import Word Document
 # Select a secured(password protected) word document and click the "Import" button

h2. Expected behavior

 * OR, the import will proceed initially, but when an error is encountered, display a user-friendly error like "This file is encrypted and can therefore not be imported"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, when dragging & dropping a new version of an image to a page while viewing it and then accessing edit mode, the new version of the image is not displayed. To reflect this change to edit mode, the page needs to be published again with/without any changes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page, add an image, and save it.
 # In view mode, drag and drop a new version of the image with the same name to the page. The image is updated in *View Mode* as expected.
 # Click *Edit* to enter edit mode; the image is displayed in the previous version.

Screen Capture of the issue

[https://share.getcloudapp.com/2Nuyg4YW]
h3. Expected Results

Edit mode will display the new version of the image.
h3. Actual Results

Edit mode will display the previous version of the image.
h3. Workaround
 * After uploading a new version of the image in view mode, accessing edit mode (at this point, you see the old version), and publishing it with/without any changes, reflects the change you did in view mode if you go again in edit mode.

h4. Findings

(i) When the _Disable cache_ feature of the browser's developer tools is enabled, it is working as expected.
fields.summary: Image is not updated in edit mode when using drag and drop

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you copy code from the Code Block Macro in edit mode into any plain text editor, the code loses the line breaks. This effectively removes all code indentation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy any code from the code block macro in edit mode by selecting the code and copy via CTRL+C/CMD+C
 # Paste the copied copy in a plain text editor or web page.

h3. Expected Results

The copied code is pasted maintaining the indentation of the code.
h3. Actual Results

All the line breaks are removed from the code, subsequently removing all code indentation. Attaching the screen recording for the same.

[^Codeblock copypaste.mov]
h3. Workaround
 * Click on the Code Block macro frame and then hit CTRL/CMD+C the newlines are retained when pasting the text elsewhere.
fields.summary: Pasting code from the Code Block Macro in edit mode removes line break

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user is typing something is the quick search box (or in the KB search field in JSD), Confluence is receiving a series of subsequent requests, for example:
 * Why do
 * Why dogs c
 * Why dogs cannot fl
 * Why dogs cannot fly?

Small instances are able to provide the answers quickly (before the next request is received).

In case of the large instances, processing of each request could take a few seconds. As a result, Confluence could be overwhelmed with processing a lot of similar requests. What's more, a browser cancelled all previous requests, so the server is just wasting its resources, because nothing is waiting for the results. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a large instance where each search request takes a few seconds
 # Start typing something in quick search box (or in JSD KB search). You should add a delay of one second between entering characters (in this case a separate search request will be sent for each character).
 # Make a thread dump and see that a lot of threads are searching the documents. 

h3. Expected Results

Cancel and stop the previous search request(s), sent by this user.

Note: the thread should wait until the previous search request finished its work. Because each search request processing consists of two parts:
 # Get all allowed/not allowed spaces
 # Scan the documents

The first part could be slow (if there is nothing in the cache) and we can't interrupt it. It's better to wait until this part is finished, and the results will be put to the cache. So the second thread will be able to use cached values.

The second part can be interrupted any time.

Also, if a search request notice that there are two (configurable) or more requests are already doing "search" for this user, it should respond with "too many requests" and do not block one more thread.
h3. Actual Results

A lot of threads are "searching" something.
h3. Workaround

Disable quick search. Disable KB plugin.
fields.summary: Confluence does not stop processing the previous search request if it receives another one

While the user can easily query for a particular status, appending ?status=current (or archived) to the request, it would be useful to get a complete list of spaces with their respective status.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you are logged in Confluence through SAML SSO, with Confluence Administrator permission you can't access SSO 2.0 configuration.

By clicking on this menu item, you are redirected to the IdP login page and entering user credentials result in an infinite redirection to the same login form.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Confluence with SAML SSO as the primary authentication
 # Log with a user that has Confluence Administrator permission (and isn't a System Administrator)
 # Access the SSO 2.0 menu in Confluence Administration

h3. Expected Results
 * A message informing the lack of permission to access this feature is displayed; *or*
 * A Confluence Administrator can't see the SSO 2.0 menu; *or*
 * Be allowed to see the SSO 2.0 configuration screen

h3. Actual Results
 * User is redirected to the IdP login page and can't exit the redirection loop.
 ** /login.action?os_destination=%2Fplugins%2Fservlet%2Fauthentication-config&permissionViolation=true
 ** /plugins/servlet/authentication-config
 ** /login.action?os_destination=%2Fplugins%2Fservlet%2Fauthentication-config&permissionViolation=true
 ** /plugins/servlet/authentication-config
 ** etc.

h3. Workaround
 * There's no workaround. If the user needs to access the SSO 2.0 settings, he'll need a System Administrator permission.
fields.summary: Accessing SSO 2.0 configuration as a Confluence Administrator ends up in an infinite login loop

fields.description:
Hi, 
According to the specific of our Product, we do need to have a search for a whole word and phrases. 
Just for an example 
It needs to search the ticket number called "CORE-15993"
Our Customers don't know the rules of searching in Confluence. They always try to search CORE-15993 (without doubled quotes) and as a result, they can see tons of links related to words "CORE" "core" and number 15993 instead of one result when searching "CORE-15993"

It would be nice to add somewhere in an admin page of the Confluence portal possibility of enabling\disabling the possibility of adding double quotes to each search request.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When exporting PDF from Confluence, wide images within the "Expand Macro" container  are cut as they are wider than the page. an example is attached
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and insert "Expand Macro"
 # Insert an image inside Expand macro (in this test image size is 1581 × 81 px)
 # Click on "..." >> export to PDF

h3. Expected Results

The wide image inside "Expand Macro" should be visible and not cut
h3. Actual Results

Not the whole image is displayed in the exported PDF file
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: PDF Export function does not resize the content of expand macro to fit within the PDF page

fields.description:
h3. Background

From my research, there is no current way to share a template across multiple spaces without making it global to all users. We are in a large company with many separate spaces and tens of thousands of users, so global is too broad for most templates that a team would create.

For example, one team with their own space has created a functional spec template that other users in a different space may find useful, but we don't want to spam thousands of people with this in their create page popups. 

The current solutions I see are:

1) Create a new template in the 2nd space by copy and paste   .. or ..

2) Create a global template for all Confluence users

 

This is also related to the ability to [copy/import/export|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-7752?error=login_required&error_description=Login+required&state=4f84a1bf-7b50-4e6b-8c50-b0c726e4ed8f] templates using other than the keyboard copy and paste shortcuts. 
h3. Request

This request is for an intermediate template option where a template can be configured to share across _some_ spaces within the Confluence installation but not _all_ spaces like a global template would.
h3. Benefits:
 * Reduce redundancy and manual effort to maintain templates that may be evolving across spaces
 * Restrict global template views to only relevant spaces.

 

Reference:

[Community discussion how to share templates|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-do-I-share-templates-between-spaces-in-Confluence/qaq-p/84806]
fields.summary: Share a template across multiple spaces but not globally

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After a space import, the *{{Page properties Report}}* macro with ancestor doesn't work as it still references the page ID of the previous instance.
(i) When using  *{{Content by Label}}* macro with "With Ancestor" filter, the issue described below applies to this macro as well.

h3. Environment
* Tested in Confluence 7.4.1 and Confluence 7.4.4
* The Origin Space can be from a Cloud instance or a Server/DC instance and the same issue happens

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. In the origin Space follow the Steps below:
# Create a new page, let's name it 'Parent Page'
# Create a child page under the newly created page, let's name it 'Child Page'
# In the 'Child page' add a *Page properties* macro and configure it with any information. For example:
 !child_property.png|thumbnail! 
# Label this 'Child page' with a new label, let's say 'test'
# In the 'Parent Page' add the *Page properties report* macro and configure it to filter for
#* Label: 'test'
#* In space: 'Current Space'
#* Add a new filter 'With ancestor' and Search for 'Parent page' it will look like this:
 !macro01.png|thumbnail! 
# Save the changes and Publish the page
# Go to Space tools > Content Tools > Export select XML as the option and create a Full Export of this space.

h4. In the target instance follow the steps below:

# Go to General configuration > Backup & Restore and import the newly created space export
# Once the import completes, go to the imported space > Parent Page

Here is the space exported from a test instance: [^Confluence-space-export-173616-4.xml.zip] 

h3. Expected Results

You would see the Parent Page with the Page properties report macro showing the correct content.

h3. Actual Results

The macro in the 'Parent Page' will show 'No content found'
 !no_content.png|thumbnail! 

When you edit the page and edit the macro to check its configuration you no longer see the title of the page selected in the 'With ancestor' option, it will display the page ID, however, this is the page ID of the previous instance.
 !with_page_id.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Delete the reference of the Page ID and search the page by its title instead, save the changes and publish the page.
fields.summary: After Space import the Page properties report macro with ancestor doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the START value in a REST API search reaches 100,000+ it appears to ignore the START value and just returns the result set from 100,000 through LIMIT, as if the START value was 100,000 (regardless of what it set to).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a REST API content search for a very large result set (100,000+ records)
 # Use [Pagination|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/pagination-in-the-rest-api/] to search past your defined limit (or past the default limit of 500 records returned)
 # Continue this search past the first 100,000 records in the result set 

h3. Expected Results

All records in the 100,000+ result set are returned if queried for (limited to to a max 500 at a time).
h3. Actual Results

Only the first 100,500 records are returnable by the REST API search (which is the 100,000 [MAX_START_OFFSET|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/6.6.0/index.html?constant-values.html] value + the the 500 [MAX_LIMIT|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/6.6.0/index.html?constant-values.html] value)

Examples:
{code:java}
SUCCESS = "self": "/rest/api/content/search?expand=history,version&limit=200&start=99800&cql=%28type%3Dpage%20and%20lastModified%3Cnow%28%27-104w%27%29"

SUCCESS = "self": "/rest/api/content/search?expand=history,version&limit=200&start=100000&cql=%28type%3Dpage%20and%20lastModified%3Cnow%28%27-104w%27%29%"

FAILURE = "self": "/rest/api/content/search?expand=history,version&limit=200&start=100200&cql=%28type%3Dpage%20and%20lastModified%3Cnow%28%27-104w%27%29%"
{code}
"Failure" here being that the final query didn't return the correct result set, it returned the *exact* same results as the 2nd query. 
h3. Workaround

Limit the search by space, and iterate over all spaces if needed. It's very unlikely that a single space will have more than 100k pages, so that approach would circumvent this limitation. A draft of the logic can be found here:
 [^get-all-pages.py] 

The script above users */rest/api/content* instead of the *search* endpoint. This means all pages are returned, including the ones with restrictions applied if running it with an admin account.

Alternatively, SQL queries could be used in place of a REST call to accomplish similar goals.
fields.summary: REST API search results limited to first 100,500 records

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you copy text from another source (web, plain text editor, code editor) and then paste it into the *Code Block* or the *No Format* macro, the leading white spaces are removed. This effectively removes all code indentation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Type some indented code in a plain text editor or code editor
 # Copy the text to your clip board (right-click copy or CTRL+C/CMD+C)
 # Create a page
 # Insert the Code Block macro
 # Paste the previously copied code

h3. Expected Results

The copied text is pasted exactly as is.
h3. Actual Results

All the leading spaces are removed, subsequently removing all code indentation.

!Screen Shot 2020-09-18 at 10.39.45.png|width=366,height=169!

!Screen Shot 2020-09-18 at 10.40.04.png|width=373,height=115!
h3. Workaround

None. We need to manually indent the code.
fields.summary: Pasting text on the Code Macro or the No Format Macro removes leading white spaces

    "currentPage": 0,

    "renderedHeadings": [
        "Jobs",

    ],

        {

}{noformat}

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...

Page Properties Reports macro can no longer be placed on the same page as the 'Page Properties' macro using the bundled plugin *confluence-masterdetail-plugin-5.3.10.jar*

 # Install or upgrade to Confluence 7.7.x
 # Create a page and place a *Page Properties* macro on the page
 # Add a *Page Properties Report* to the same page referencing the label from the page
 # Save
 # Notice the following error: {noformat}We can't display a report when the property passed to the report is the report itself.{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
*Page Properties Reports* should be shown as in previous Confluence versions up to 7.6.+

h3. Actual Results

{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently if you want to make your site visible publicly, you must enable anonymous access at site level.
 # In the Global permission page in the *Anonymous Access* section, select the *Can use* checkbox.  

And Space administrators can grant editing permissions to anonymous users permissions on a space by space basis to make spaces public. 

Having said that there is no configuration available, which can suppress space edit permission for the anonymous users globally(for all the spaces at once).

The configuration which can be set by Confluence administrator in global permission to make site read only for anonymous users (they should not allowed to edit page or comment even space administrator assigned permission)
h3. *Suggested Solution*

The configuration which can be set by Confluence administrator in global permission section to make site read only for anonymous users (after setting up the configuration, anonymous users should not be allowed to edit page or comment in any space even space administrator has assigned permission)
h3. *Why This Is Important*

_When there are more spaces in the site it is difficult to manage._

_So if Confluence administrator wants ready only access for anonymous users they have to manage at space permission level ._ 
h3. *Workaround*

_Manage permission at the space level permission section._
fields.summary: Configuration for Anonymous access control in Global permission section

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you add a Jira Issue Macro to a page and include the 'Description' column to be displayed, the row in the Jira macro can be very long if the 'Description' column has a lot of data.

 !JIM Sample.png|thumbnail! 

This can occur for any columns that have a large amount of data to display, not just 'Description'.

h3. Suggestion
Provide the functionality to collapse certain fields as opted by the user when adding the macro. This will result in the data to be hidden and users have to expand the information before it'll be displayed.
fields.summary: Allow columns in the Jira Issue Macro to be collapsed

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When creating a new page and adding multiple attachments (the format or size doesn't seem to matter) via Drag-and-Drop at once, the Initial Page title will get removed and the next attempts to publish will fail

h3. Environment
Behavior reproduced with Confluence version *7.7.3* out-of-the-box installation and using:
* Chrome Version 85.0.4183.102 (Official Build) (64-bit) 
* Firefox Version 80.0.1 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a new page
* Add a Page Title
* Drag-and-Drop 3 or multiple files on the page (in my testing 3 txt files containing one character each)
* Attempt to Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The Page should be published without issue.

h3. Actual Results
The Page Title gets removed and the following attempt(s) to Publish the page will fail.

h3. Workaround
* Drag-and-drop files one at a time and not in batch
* Reloading the page in the browser and adding the title back will get the publish action to work

h3. Notes
A recording illustrating the issue is attached
fields.summary: Batch Drag-and-drop of files cause the Publish Action to fail

fields.description:
As per [Edit in Office Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf74/edit-in-office-using-the-office-connector-1003128753.html] the only way to edit the document is trough:
- Attachments page
- Attachments macro
- Office Word and Office Excel macros 
- Office PowerPoint macro

It should be possible as before (6.13.x) to have this option in the preview header, like this:
 !Screen Shot 2020-09-16 at 17.35.15.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: With old edit in office functionality it should be possible to edit document from a preview.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the preview of Microsoft document (pptx, word or excel file) and only under Internet Explorer it is possible to click on Edit in the office button, without any effect. As per [edit in office documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf74/edit-in-office-using-the-office-connector-1003128753.html] this is not possible and the only possible options are:
- Attachments page
- Attachments macro (choose Edit in Office beside each attached office file) 
- Office Word and Office Excel macros – choose the Edit button above the content.
- Office PowerPoint macro – choose the edit icon on the viewer.

The button is *not visible* in Edge, Chrome or Firefox. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence 7.4.1 on Windows.
 # Enable edit in office in Confluence Administration > Office Connector.
 # Create a page and add an excel document
 # In IE click on the excel document in order to generate the preview.
 # Once the preview is generated header icons

h3. Expected Results
In the header icons, 3 dots icons will not be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
In the header icons, 3 dots icons will not be displayed, and under it we can see Edit in Office button, that does not work.
 !Screen Shot 2020-09-16 at 17.35.15.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use this styling to remove the button from preview:
{code}
@media screen and (-ms-high-contrast: active), (-ms-high-contrast: none) {  
.cp-file-controls.cp-header-item .fv-button .cp-control-panel-more.cp-icon.cp-dropdown {    
display:none;    
}  
} 
{code}
fields.summary: In the preview of Microsoft document and only under internet explorer it is possible to click on Edit in office button, without any effect.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When setting up an event from a Jira Issue during the period of 24 hours from Nov 1st, 2 AM to Nov 2nd, 2 AM, the event goes back 1 hour on Team Calendars.
 Customers cannot plan in advance during that day because of this issue.
 Timezones: CST/EST
h3. Environment

Team Calendar 6.053
 Confluence 7.4
 Jira 8.8
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * We scheduled a new event starting at 1 AM on Nov 1st.
 ** Confluence adds an event at 1 AM on Nov 1st.
 * We scheduled a new event starting at 3 AM on Nov 1st.
 ** Confluence adds an event at 2 AM on Nov 1st.
 * We scheduled a new event starting at 2 AM on Nov 2nd.
 ** Confluence adds an event at 1 AM on Nov 2nd.
 * We scheduled a new event starting at 5 PM on Nov 1st.
 ** Confluence adds an event at 4 PM on Nov 1st.
 * Jira issue is being triggered by the Date format: 11/1/2020 03:00 AMERICAS\New_York

h3. Expected Results

Team Calendars show the correct time when they were created
h3. Actual Results

During that 24 hour period, the event goes back 1 hour
h3. Workaround

No workarounds so far.
fields.summary: Team Calendar showing wrong start time after daylight savings goes into effect and out of effect

fields.description:
h3. Problem In a Confluence page containing 2 or more expand macros including one with a table. If you remove one of the macros and save the page. The comparison between current and previous version of the page will be incorrect. h3. Environment Confluence Server v7.5.2 h3. Steps to Reproduce * Create a new Confluence page with the storage format below {code:HTML}


My Expand 1

My expand 1


My Expand 2

My expand 2


My Expand 3

My expand 3 with a table


qwe qwe qwe
qwe qwe qwe
qwe qwe qwe


{code} * Publish the page * Edit the page, remove the last expand macro and save the page * Compare current and previous version of the page h3. Expected Results The 2nd Expand Macro is shown as deleted but it has not been touched at all. h3. Actual Results The 2nd Expand Macro should not be marked as deleted h3. Workaround N/A h3. Notes A small recording is attached for your convenience
fields.summary: Deleting an Expand Macro that includes a Table causes an Invalid historical data comparison

fields.description:
h1. Background

At the moment, if a space has permissions for 10 different groups, and Confluence needs to check is user has an access to the space, it call this method 10 times:
{code:java}
crowdService.isUserMemberOfGroup(userName, groupName) {code}
If there are a plenty of groups, each call would take some time, and users will notice the slowness of the system.
h1. Possible solutions
h2. Solution 1. We need a method in Crowd like:
{code:java}
crowdService.isUserMemberOfAnyGroup(userName, groupNameList) {code}
It would improve performance, but it requires to change Crowd API. 
h2. Solution 2. Retrieve all user groups only once

Another way (without modifying Crowd) is to retrieve all user’s groups first (Crowd allows to do this). And then check check user's groups against space groups without calling Crowd again.

The only problem could be if a user is a part of thousands of groups, but, fortunately, the result will be cached and used for any other space.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence does not have an option to export page from history as Word
h3. Steps to reproduce

Tested on Confluence 7.3.5

1) Created new page
 2) Edit content
 3) Opened Info->View page history and clicked on first version of document
 4) There is no option to 'Export to Word'
h3. Workaround

There are some potential workarounds.
 * Pasting the PageID of the old page version into the URL "https://example.com/exportword?pageId=<>" works like a charm. So all that needs to be done is to include this button in the "three dots menu (...)" when viewing old page versions.
 * The simplest is to restore to the previous version you want to export, perform the export, and then restore back to the current version.
 * If you would like a record of all the previous versions you have printed, or you do not want to alter your version history which restores just for printing you could also copy the previous version to a new space when viewing them:
{quote} # Create a new space - eg; Old Versions
 # View the page to export - published version
 # View page history
 # Click on a previous version to view it
 # Now copy to the new space
 # Export to word from the new space{quote}

You can delete these restores if you do not want it cluttering your history.
fields.summary: Word Export of historical page versions

fields.description:
h3. Problem
*Could not get unique fields for table* and *java.sql.SQLException: Invalid argument(s) in call* errors after installation. Some UI functions might also not be working properly, like the workbox notifications or other menus.

h3. Environment

# Oracle Database

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Follow the documentation to configure Oracle
#* https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-oracle-173821.html
# While running it, Create a user with a dot on the name (example: conf.admin)
# Install Confluence and connect to this database

h3. Expected Results

No errors are seen and the instance works as expected.

h3. Actual Results

Some UI functionalities fail and this is seen repeateadly on the *atlassian-confluence.log* file:
{code}
/rest/mywork/latest/status/notification/count | traceId: e33f4ce1cc7be186 | userName: admin
java.lang.RuntimeException: bundle [com.atlassian.mywork.confluence-host-plugin]. Listener: com.atlassian.mywork.host.service.ClientServiceImpl event: com.atlassian.mywork.host.event.BeforeCountNewNotificationsEvent
    at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:57)
    ...
Caused by: com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsInitException: bundle [com.atlassian.mywork.confluence-host-plugin]
    at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects$1$1$1.call(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:95)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not get unique fields for table 'AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION'
    at net.java.ao.schema.helper.DatabaseMetaDataReaderImpl.getUniqueFields(DatabaseMetaDataReaderImpl.java:191)
    at net.java.ao.schema.helper.DatabaseMetaDataReaderImpl.getFields(DatabaseMetaDataReaderImpl.java:85)
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Invalid argument(s) in call
    at oracle.jdbc.OracleDatabaseMetaData.getIndexInfo(OracleDatabaseMetaData.java:3777)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Since Oracle does not allow renaming the schema, you need to drop it and create a new one without dots. Following the initial example, conf_admin should work fine. On the Confluence side, restart the application setup so it can create the tables on the new schema:

# Stop Confluence
# Remove *<Confluence-home>/confluence.cfg.xml*
# Restart Confluence
# You should be prompted to complete the setup again

h3. Notes

This has previously been reported as a suggestion, but opening it as a bug since Oracle itself allows schema names with dots based on the documentation:

* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33680
* https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B19306_01/server.102/b14200/sql_elements008.htm
fields.summary: 'Could not get unique fields for table' errors constantly printed on the logs after installation

fields.summary: Enable comments while in edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The Confluence Mobile app is set to point to the login.action when a user attempts to login to Confluence. However, this impacts the use of IDP such as Okta, as users aren't redirected to the custom login page while using the app. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a login URL field option to the admin page of the Mobile App, similar to the Jira Mobile App.
h3. Why This Is Important

_Would Allow our users to integrate with 3rd-party providers and still take advantage of using the Confluence Mobile._ 
h3. Workaround

_If a reverse proxy is in play, we can set a forwarding rule at the proxy to redirect the Confluence login.action page to the 3rd-party provider's login._
fields.summary: Confluence Mobile App doesn't redirect to IDP login page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Audit log uses default language settings instead of user profile language

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use confluence administrator account to login
# Change default system language to non-English language setting for example German or Russian
# Change user profile language to English
# Access audit log

h3. Expected Results
Audit log records are displayed using user (admin) profile language

h3. Actual Results
Default language is being used

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Display Audit log in user profile language

fields.description:
Looking for files in the .atlassian-companion when files cannot be uploaded (lost connection, closed browser window, Word crashed, etc) is not something a regular user would do. This is to complicated.

reference:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-access-confluence-files-edited-with-the-atlassian-companion-app-955178822.html]

The Companion app should know where the last version of the file was closed and if it should resume editing of that file next time the user wants to edit it. 

Or even better, auto upload regularly (autosafe) to the Confluence page. One could then be asked to either open the autosaved version, the one on your computer (if the same user) or the latest uploaded.
fields.summary: Companion app - document edit resuming

fields.description:
h3. Summary

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition

When using JIT provisioning in Confluence Data Center, you can't access Confluence Administration because the websudo form gives a *wrong credentials* error.
h4. Suggested Solution

I am requesting an enhancement to allow websudo to work with SAML setup as well as to allow websudo to work with other marketplace SAML plugins.
h4. Workaround

There are two possible workarounds to access Confluence Administration:
 * *Disable the secure sessions*, removing the websudo form. As a side-effect, you can go straight into administration functions without confirmation that you should. This poses a security risk.
 ** See [Configuring Secure Administrator Sessions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Secure+Administrator+Sessions].
 * *Set a new password for the user that was created with JIT provisioning*: JIT provisioning creates a user in Confluence Internal Directory and you can define a password for this user. As a side-effect, an administrator will have 2 passwords - the IdP password to log in Confluence and the Internal password to authenticate in secure-sessions.
fields.summary: Ability to have the Websudo functionality working with SAML / SSO

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user has curly bracket in the username, People Directory fails to display such user correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create user with username "myuser}"
 # Go to People Directory at /confluence/browsepeople.action

h3. Expected Results

The user correctly shown.
h3. Actual Results

Error messages om screen like
{noformat}
User 'myuser' not found
{noformat}
or (in case of more characters in the username)
{code:java}
{profile:user=user `~!@#$%^&*()-_={}[]|:.'? name-1958284144|mode=people-directory}
{code}
h3. Workaround

Avoid using curly bracket in the user name.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
XML export of space or site consumes a lot of computing resources and can affect the performance of other operation in Confluence. 
e.g. Someone runs XML export of a huge space and it causes garbage collection ending up with an overall performance degradation.
 
h3.  Suggested Solution
Let the XML export run in the [External Process Pool for Confluence Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/external-process-pool-for-confluence-data-center-958779098.html]
fields.summary: Run XML export in sandbox process

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition


As a Confluence user, I want to be able to have a popup message displayed when a new file is uploaded for export control considerations, and currently, we don't have that option.

h3. Suggested Solution

The Popup box should display "Have you checked with the content owner to ensure the export markings are current and accurate?"

With "Yes" and "No" options

If the user selects "Yes" the upload is allowed to proceed.
If the user selects "No" the upload is denied

h3. Why this is important

This is important so we can ensure accountability for export markings.

h3. Workaround

n/a
fields.summary: As a Confluence user I'd like to have a popup message for export control considerations before every attachment/file upload

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 If we are using any macro on a confluence page and that macro result shows some more results then on the bottom of the macro will get the scroll bar on the bottom of it.

The suggestion is to get that scrollbar on the top.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a macro to a page, make sure it has many results.
 # It will have a scrollbar on the bottom of the page.

h3. Suggestion

The scrollbar should be at the top as it's a bit annoying to have it on the bottom and go all the way down.
fields.summary: Put macros scrollbar on top instead of in the bottom

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While using Chart macro if any of the columns have Chinese, its not rendered properly


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Confluence v7.6.1
# Java 11.0.7
 # Windows OS
# Create a page with Chart macro
 !chart-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Enter some Chinese columns in it
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The Chart should render Chinese columns properly

h3. Actual Results

Chart shows square boxes for Chinese columns
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

The title of the Chart is still rendered properly. It's just the columns runs into this issue.

h3. *Notes*

Tested with the following versions of Java with the same issue,
* jdk8u265-b01
* jdk 11.0.7
* jdk 11.0.8


h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inserting roadmap macro throws error upon review in a space Template created by user with confluence-user privileges.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user added to group Confluence-users who has confluence-administrator privileges but not the system administrator privileges
 # Login as above user
 # Go to Space tools>> Content Tools>>Templates>> Create a new Template
 # Create a Test Template
 # Insert macro "Roadmap planner"
 # Click on preview which throws the following error:
{code:java}
Error rendering macro 'roadmap'
Could not check permissions for page: Template Preview v.1 (0) no suitable delegate found.
{code}
# Same error is present upon saving the Template
# Enabling the system-administrators privileges within confluence-users group does not work either.

h3. Expected Results
Roadmap planner macro should get inserted without any error

h3. Actual Results
Error is thrown as depicted in attached screeshot

h3. Workaround
Currently, only workaround that works is when user is mapped to system-administrators group. The error does not appear if user is part of system-administrators group.
fields.summary: Inserting roadmap macro throws error upon review in a space Template created by user with confluence-user privileges

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary When a macro is inserted in a page, the Confluence editor adds the following HTML tag before the macro code: {code:xml}


{code} Pointing the editor cursor to the line with this code and adding line breaks will create new paragraphs with the same class tag. When the page is published, these paragraphs are not rendered as expected in page view mode, since they are not treated as new lines. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Install a vanilla instance of Confluence. #* This was validated on Confluence 7.4.3 and 7.7.2. #* The issue did *not* exist on Confluence *6.6.3* nor on *6.13.4*. #* The issue does not occur if Collaborative Editing is disabled on the affected versions. # Create a new Space. # Create a sample page. # In the first line of the page add an Info Macro. # Use the _up arrow_ keyboard button to go the previous line and add another Info Macro. # Use the _down arrow_ keyboard button to go the next line, which will be between both macros. # Use the _return (enter)_ keyboard button to add new lines between the two macros. !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! # Publish the page. h3. Expected Results When the page is displayed, the new lines created between the two Info Macros are properly rendered as blank space. h3. Actual Results There's no new line between the two macros. If you check the storage format it will be as below: {code:xml}












{code} \\ \\ !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! h3. Workaround When editing the page, select all lines between the macros and use the CMD+0 (CTRL+0) [keyboard shortcut|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/keyboard-shortcuts-139456.html] to change them to the regular paragraph formatting.
fields.summary: Adding line breaks between two macros in a Confluence page won't be properly rendered as new lines

fields.description:
Atlassian says they have an "eap" label for the latest EAP release in dockerhub:
[https://hub.docker.com/r/atlassian/confluence-server/ 5|https://hub.docker.com/r/atlassian/confluence-server/]
_"For the latest developer (EAP) release use {{atlassian/confluence-server:eap}} . This will install our latest milestone (not supported for use in production)."_

It's not true. There is no such tag in Confluence's docker hub. We need it.

There is a "latest" image and we use that for the latest published version but we need an "eap" label so we don't have to dig through the various "76-eap-1", "76-eap-2", ... labels to find the latest EAP image.

Every time there is an EAP release we have to: 1) notice it, 2) go find out where the image is

To add to that, there is no 7.8 label with "eap" in it.  It looks like 7.6 is the last time Atlassian used eap in a docker image label. The docker hub image label naming is inconsistent.

 

Here is the community thread about this:

[https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/confluence-docker-images-we-need-a-generic-eap-tag/40502]
fields.summary: Confluence 7.8 EAP Feedback

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The cursor moves automatically when trying to place the cursor right after a column macro inside a section macro in a Blog post. It doesn't happen in pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Blog post
 # In the editor, add a Section macro
 # Inside the section macro, add a Column macro
 # Try to place the cursor immediately below the Column macro

h3. Expected Results

The cursor would stay where you clicked so you can type.
h3. Actual Results

The cursor moves up automatically. See the recording below with issue reproduction and workaround.

[^Test_recording.mov]
h3. Workaround

Add some text inside the Section macro before the column macro and don't leave any empty space between the text and the Column macro and you'll be able to type below the Column macro.
fields.summary: Cursor moves automatically after section/column macro added to Blog post

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some Confluence macros could call other macros which would lead to recursive calls. Such operations are resource-extensive and could caused performance issue in Confluence.

h3. Suggested Solution
For Confluence to limit the macro's recursion depth, in order to avoid high resource utilisation and {{StackOverflowError}} in specific.

h3. Workaround 
Once identified, disable the culprit apps/plugins temporarily.
fields.summary: Prevent recursive macro execution

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is an issue in assigning Space/Global permissions.

When a user or group is added in the Permissions but after clicking on add, Cancel is clicked, Permissions are still assigned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Global/Space Permissions in Global Configuration
 # Click on edit and search a group name is permission and click on add
 # Once you click on add, the group/ user is assigned the permission
 # Click on Cancel and not Save

h3. Expected Results

Since the user has clicked on cancel, permissions should not be assigned
h3. Actual Results

Permissions are assigned even after clicking Cancel
h3. Workaround

No Workaround
fields.summary: Global/Space Permission Issue

fields.description: Currently Confluence allows space/site file imports from the Confluence administration panel up to 25mb - please  increase this size value to higher number (or allow custom setup)
fields.summary: Increase 25mb space/site file import limit

fields.description:
User story: In a page property report everything is transported what a cell contains. The report lists the desired property content of a page. Often I am asked how to set background colours in the report table or how to highlight something. We used status macro for that but when we use status macros then the affected row cannot be sorted. The table as an overview helps to prioritize but there is no way to show more than the content - maybe the priority set. The native move would be to set a background color like in MS Excel. This is what we would like to achieve.
Our Request: Make it work that with the page properties also the background-color of the table cell will be shown in the property report.
Effect: the overview can contain more infos than cell values: background-colors can offer more dimensions necessary to compare or display information - which then is a better basis for decisions.
fields.summary: save color of table cell besides content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A URL to the unknown attachment place-holder utilizes http instead of https when base URL is set to https, and tomcat server.xml scheme is set to https.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and add an attachment to it.
 # Open Attachments page from the view page and remove the attachment file
 # Open the view page and inspect the unknown attachment placeholder

h3. Expected Results

It uses https
h3. Actual Results

It uses http
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
h4. Related tickets

A similar issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-57934

Original report: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-55928?focusedCommentId=2494754&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-2494754
fields.summary: A URL to the unknown attachment place-holder utilizes http instead of https when https is configured

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Code Block Macro with multiple of 1024 characters wrapped with square bracket [] is not able to be saved

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page in Confluence
# Insert a Code Block Macro in the page
# Paste the text below into the Code Block Macro:
{code}
[]
{code}
(i) There is exactly 1024 characters, including the opening and closing *square bracket*. This can also occur if it is a multiple of 1024 characters such as 2048.
# Save or Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
Page with the Code Block Macro can be saved without issue

h3. Actual Results
The page cannot be saved and the error message below can be seen from the pop-up:
bq. Unable to communicate with server. Saving is not possible at the moment.

The error stacktrace below is observed in the log:
{code}
2020-09-03 22:43:20,465 ERROR [http-nio-6740-exec-5] [rest.api.model.ExceptionConverter] convertServiceException No status code found for exception, converting to internal server error :
 -- referer: http://localhost:6740/pages/resumedraft.action?draftId=8683523&draftShareId=e523b968-31c4-4f99-a818-e2cb2a0f94c1& | url: /rest/api/content/8683522 | traceId: 4702de3bc9c5e11d | userName: admin
com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.ServiceException: java.lang.RuntimeException: org.owasp.validator.html.ScanException: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1024
        at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.content.ContentBodyConversionManagerImpl.lambda$computeConversionResources$1(ContentBodyConversionManagerImpl.java:110)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.ReadOnlyAndReadWriteTransactionConversionTemplate.executeInReadWrite(ReadOnlyAndReadWriteTransactionConversionTemplate.java:65)
...
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: org.owasp.validator.html.ScanException: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1024
        at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.PolicyConfiguredCleaner.antiSamyClean(PolicyConfiguredCleaner.java:190)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.PolicyConfiguredCleaner.cleanEntityBody(PolicyConfiguredCleaner.java:140)
...
Caused by: org.owasp.validator.html.ScanException: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1024
        at org.owasp.validator.html.scan.AntiSamySAXScanner.scan(AntiSamySAXScanner.java:153)
        at org.owasp.validator.html.AntiSamy.scan(AntiSamy.java:101)
...
Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1024
        at com.atlassian.xhtml.serialize.AllowCDataSectionXHTMLSerializer.characters(AllowCDataSectionXHTMLSerializer.java:66)
        at org.apache.xalan.transformer.TransformerIdentityImpl.characters(TransformerIdentityImpl.java:1126)
{code}

h3. Information
This issue persists regardless if the Collaborative Editing is turned On or Off

h3. Workaround
Add or remove some characters so that the content in the Code Block Macro doesn't fulfill *both* of the conditions below:
* There is a multiple of 1024 characters in the macro content
* The content starts with _left square bracket_ ( [ ) and ends with _right square bracket_ ( ] )
fields.summary: Code Block Macro with multiple of 1024 characters wrapped with square bracket [] is not able to be saved
